column4: Can somebody walk me through some package problems? Neither apt or aptitude want to update the kernel image and modules to the newest version. I'm using an older Ubuntu, but I don't remember which one
start with lsb_release -a
okay. I'll tell you in just a sec
It's Hardy, 8.04
and now uname -r please
2.6.24-26-generic. That's the one it's stuck on installing
thats the latest for hardy see http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy-updates/base/
That's the one it's trying to update to. It's sticking on the configuration.
no - you are actually running that one - believe me
Okay. apt is complaining at me, anyway. Am I doing something wrong?
I don't know - what is it complaining about?
Errors were encountered while processing:
use !pastebin
Those are the only three packages it's complaining about.
but it tells you a bit more I think... - if you like you can ignore the errors ...
i'll give you the whole output. It's on my dad's notebook. I think it's been bothering him for a while
ok, be sure to use pastebin please
I'll be good
oh, I'm dumb. Gzip is complaining that the disk is full
I'll send you the rest of it if you're interested, but I'm gonna try clearing out some files and seeing if that fixes is
I guess that will be the issue - no need for the file if you found it yourself - Good luck :-)
Thanks. Have a good day.
same to you
